paper_abstract: A mixed dominating set of a simple graph G = (V, E) is a subset D subset of V boolean OR E such that every vertex or edge not in D is adjacent or incident to at least one vertex or edge in D. The mixed domination problem is to determine a minimum mixed dominating set of G. This paper studies mixed domination in graphs from an algorithmic point of view. In particular, a linear-time labeling algorithm for the mixed domination problem in cacti is presented. In addition, we fix an incomplete proof of the NP-completeness of the mixed domination problem in split graphs Zhao et al. (2011) [23]. Finally, we establish a primal-dual algorithm for the mixed domination problem in trees. (C) 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the mixed domination problem in graphs
